entries.meaning: Of, relating to or having the properties of the imperfective aspect.
examples: In the last chapter, we observed the rise of an imperfective marker in English, the Progressive, as the dominant and surviving member of a wider paradigm of imperfective aspectual functions in Old English, but which were no longer marked in the same way in later stages of the history of English.

entries.meaning: The imperfective aspect; a verb having this aspect.
examples: Examples of past imperfectives are shown in (42).
